sentences.en: Being a raconteur is a rare - and dying - art.
sentences.cn: 当故事大王是一门不多见的 — 濒临灭绝的 — 艺术.

sentences.en: Charles Dickens was a raconteur par excellence.
sentences.cn: 查理斯·更斯是一位非常卓越的健谈者.

sentences.en: He is a natural raconteur, good-looking, athletic, intellectually curious, financially successful, and wittily self-deprecating.
sentences.cn: 他是一个天生的健谈者，相貌英俊、体格健壮、求知好学、经济成功，并且风趣地自我嘲弄。

sentences.en: He is a regal raconteur . He was born to chat.
sentences.cn: 他是故事大王,天生的好口才.

sentences.en: He spoke eight languages and was a noted raconteur.
sentences.cn: 他能说8种语言，是个出了名的讲故事高手。

sentences.en: His grandfather was a fine raconteur.
sentences.cn: 他的祖父是位很好讲故事的人.

sentences.en: The raconteur mentioned that the quotation was from the Bible.
sentences.cn: 说故事的那位来宾,指那句话是出自圣经!

words.tran_cn: 健谈者；善谈者；擅长讲故事的人

trans.tran_en: someone who is good at telling stories in an interesting and amusing way
